solution.text:
It can be imagined that 'second' hand of a clock sweeps a circle in 60 seconds
\(\Rightarrow 60sec=360^\circ \Rightarrow angle\, swept\, in\, 1\, sec=\frac {360}{60}\)
angle swept in \(_{j}_sec=_{j}_\times \frac {360}{60}=_{{6*j}}_^\circ\)
radius= hand length = _{k}_cm
\(\Rightarrow r=_{k}_\)
\(Now\,area \,of\,a \,sector=\pi \times r^2 \times \frac {\theta}{360}\)
sector area\(=\frac {22}7\times _{k}_^2 \times \frac {_{{6*j}}_}{360}\)
\(\Rightarrow area=_{{trunc(pi_val*k*k*6*j/360,2)}}_cm^2\)

content.text:
Find the area swept by the 'second' hand of a clock in _{j}_seconds.
Length of the 'second' hand of the clock is _{k}_cm
